titleStmt.title: A heavenly diurnall, glory be to God on high, peace on earth, good will towards men, it was good news, is, and ever will be, or, The long expected returne of the many publike and private humiliations of the people of God all which will by his blessing ere long, be turned into dayes of great praise and thanksgiving, and prove a fatall scourge to such traiterous, blasphemous tongues as Aulicus, &c / by I. B.
titleStmt.author: Blackwell, Jonathan.

titleStmt.title: A heavenly diurnall, glory be to God on high, peace on earth, good will towards men, it was good news, is, and ever will be, or, The long expected returne of the many publike and private humiliations of the people of God all which will by his blessing ere long, be turned into dayes of great praise and thanksgiving, and prove a fatall scourge to such traiterous, blasphemous tongues as Aulicus, &c / by I. B.
titleStmt.author: Blackwell, Jonathan.

notesStmt.note: Attributed to Jonathan Blackwell. Cf. NUC pre-1956.
Reproduction of original in Thomason Collection, British Library.
